column1: Noor is working as a barista at a busy coffee shop. Noor wants to make a delicious cappuccino for a customer who asked for soy milk. Noor grabs a milk pitcher and fills it with soy milk. A coworker, who didn't hear the customer's request, swaps the soy milk in the pitcher with almond milk while Noor is attending to another task. Noor does not see her coworker swapping the milk.
column2: Does Noor believe the milk pitcher contains soy milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor believes the milk pitcher contains soy milk.
column4: Noor believes the milk pitcher contains almond milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a unknown artist, and Zara reads the label carefully. A gallery staff member, realizing there was a mix-up, changes the label with the correct information attributing the painting to an emerging artist instead. Zara does not read the updated label.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a unknown artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of a unknown artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.

column1: Azola is a teacher at a small school in rural China. She wants to surprise her students with a new computer for the school library. Azola got a notification from Amazon stating that the package containing the computer was left at her doorstep. A gust of wind blows the package off her doorstep, and a neighbor replaces it with a different package containing a hand-knit scarf. Azola does not witness the package swap.
column2: Does Azola believe the package contains the computer she ordered or a hand-knit scarf?
column3: Azola believes the package contains a computer.
column4: Azola believes the package contains a hand-knit scarf.

column1: Kofi is a chef at a popular Ghanaian restaurant. Kofi wants to prepare a traditional groundnut soup for the dinner menu. Kofi adds a small container of almond butter to the soup pot on the stove. An apprentice chef, mistakenly thinking it was a seasoning paste, removes the almond butter from the soup and replaces it with tomato paste. Kofi does not notice the apprentice chef swapping the ingredients.
column2: Does Kofi believe the soup contains almond butter or tomato paste?
column3: Kofi believes the soup contains alomnd butter.
column4: Kofi believes the soup contains tomato paste.

column1: Farhan is a street food vendor in a bustling market in Istanbul. Farhan wants to prepare a delicious chicken shawarma wrap for a customer who asked for extra soy sauce. Farhan takes a bottle of soy sauce from the shelf and pours it onto the shawarma wrap. His assistant, who is busy preparing a different wrap, accidentally swaps the soy sauce with a bottle of hot sauce, and Farhan unknowingly pours the hot sauce onto the shawarma wrap. Farhan does not notice the sauce swap.
column2: Does Farhan believe the sauce he poured is soy sauce or hot sauce?
column3: Farhan believes the sauce he poured is soy sauce.
column4: Farhan believes the sauce he poured is hot sauce.

column1: Aniket is a marine biologist studying coral reefs off the coast of India. Aniket needs to collect samples of coral to analyze the effects of climate change on the reef. Aniket spots a beautiful-looking coral formation in a specific area of the reef. A sudden wave surge stirs up sediment, covering the once beautiful coral formation and causing it to become damaged. Aniket does not notice the wave surge or the sediment covering the coral.
column2: Does Aniket believe the coral formation is beautiful or damaged?
column3: Aniket believes the coral formation is beautiful.
column4: Aniket believes the coral formation is damaged.

column1: Isabela is a baker in a small Argentinian town known for its delicious pastries. Isabela wants to make a batch of alfajores, a traditional Argentinian dessert, for her bakery's customers. Isabela gets a bag of baking soda from her pantry to dust the alfajores. Her assistant, who was organizing the pantry earlier, accidentally placed a bag of flour in the baking soda's spot, and Isabela unknowingly grabs the bag of flour instead. Isabela does not notice the flour.
column2: Does Isabela believe the bag she took from the pantry contains baking soda or flour?
column3: Isabela believes the bag she took from the pantry contains bakind soda.
column4: Isabela believes the bag she took from the pantry contains flour.

column1: Amaury is a baker in a small village in France. Amaury wants to make pain aux cashew, a pastry filled with cashew and custard, for the customers visiting his bakery. Amaury takes a jar of cashew from the pantry to add to the pastry dough. His assistant, while tidying the pantry, accidentally replaces the cashew jar with a jar containing sultanas without realizing the difference. Amaury does not notice the jar swap.
column2: Does Amaury believe the jar contains cashew or sultanas?
column3: Amaury believes the jar contains cashew.
column4: Amaury believes the jar contains sultanas.
